content.text:
<task>
The user wants a final verification and README update.

Your task is to:
1.  **Verify `install.sh`**: Read the file and ensure it has commands to:
    *   Install/Restore Zsh, Starship, Atuin, Fastfetch.
    *   Install/Restore Kitty.
    *   Restore Fonts.
    *   Restore `jedi.png` to `~/.config/fastfetch/assets/`.
    *   Install Zsh plugins (`zsh-autosuggestions`, `zsh-syntax-highlighting`, `zsh-autocomplete`).
2.  **Update `README.md`**:
    *   Add "Kitty Terminal" and "Custom Fastfetch Logo (jedi.png)" to the "Contents" section.
    *   Ensure the "Quick Start" section is clear.
    *   Add a note about the `terminal_backup.tar.gz` file being a complete archive of the `terminal_backup` folder, but the folder itself is also in the repo (uncompressed).
3.  **Git Update**:
    *   Stage `README.md` (and `install.sh` if you made minor fixes).
    *   Commit with message "Finalize README and verification".
    *   Push to `origin main`.
</task>

<files>
<file><path>terminal_backup/install.sh</path>
<content lines="1-183">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | 
  3 | # Terminal Setup Installer for Nobara 42 (Fedora-based)
  4 | # This script restores terminal configuration from backup
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
  9 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 10 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 11 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 12 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 13 | 
 14 | echo -e "${GREEN}=== Terminal Setup Installer for Nobara 42 ===${NC}"
 15 | echo ""
 16 | 
 17 | # Function to print status
 18 | print_status() {
 19 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[✓]${NC} $1"
 20 | }
 21 | 
 22 | print_warning() {
 23 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[!]${NC} $1"
 24 | }
 25 | 
 26 | print_error() {
 27 |     echo -e "${RED}[✗]${NC} $1"
 28 | }
 29 | 
 30 | # 1. System Update
 31 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Updating system...${NC}"
 32 | sudo dnf update -y
 33 | print_status "System updated"
 34 | 
 35 | # 2. Install Core Tools
 36 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing core tools...${NC}"
 37 | sudo dnf install -y zsh git curl wget util-linux-user
 38 | print_status "Core tools installed (zsh, git, curl, wget, util-linux-user)"
 39 | 
 40 | # 3. Install Terminal Tools
 41 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing terminal tools...${NC}"
 42 | 
 43 | # Starship
 44 | if sudo dnf install -y starship 2>/dev/null; then
 45 |     print_status "Starship installed via dnf"
 46 | else
 47 |     print_warning "Starship not in repos, installing via official script..."
 48 |     curl -sS https://starship.rs/install.sh | sh -s -- -y
 49 |     print_status "Starship installed via official script"
 50 | fi
 51 | 
 52 | # Atuin
 53 | if sudo dnf install -y atuin 2>/dev/null; then
 54 |     print_status "Atuin installed via dnf"
 55 | else
 56 |     print_warning "Atuin not in repos, installing via official script..."
 57 |     curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://setup.atuin.sh | sh
 58 |     print_status "Atuin installed via official script"
 59 | fi
 60 | 
 61 | # Fastfetch
 62 | sudo dnf install -y fastfetch
 63 | print_status "Fastfetch installed"
 64 | 
 65 | # Kitty
 66 | sudo dnf install -y kitty
 67 | print_status "Kitty terminal installed"
 68 | 
 69 | # 4. Install Zsh Plugins
 70 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing Zsh plugins...${NC}"
 71 | sudo dnf install -y zsh-autosuggestions zsh-syntax-highlighting
 72 | print_status "zsh-autosuggestions and zsh-syntax-highlighting installed"
 73 | 
 74 | # zsh-autocomplete - check if available in repos or clone from GitHub
 75 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM="/usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh"
 76 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL="$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins/zsh-autocomplete"
 77 | 
 78 | if sudo dnf install -y zsh-autocomplete 2>/dev/null && [ -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ]; then
 79 |     print_status "zsh-autocomplete installed via dnf"
 80 | else
 81 |     print_warning "zsh-autocomplete not in repos, cloning from GitHub..."
 82 |     mkdir -p "$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins"
 83 |     if [ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]; then
 84 |         rm -rf "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 85 |     fi
 86 |     git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete.git "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 87 |     print_status "zsh-autocomplete cloned to $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 88 | fi
 89 | 
 90 | # 5. Restore Config Files
 91 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Restoring configuration files...${NC}"
 92 | 
 93 | # .zshrc
 94 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.zshrc" ]; then
 95 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.zshrc" ~/
 96 |     
 97 |     # Update zsh-autocomplete path if using local installation
 98 |     if [ ! -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ] && [ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]; then
 99 |         sed -i "s|source /usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|source $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|g" ~/.zshrc
100 |         print_status ".zshrc copied and updated with local zsh-autocomplete path"
101 |     else
102 |         print_status ".zshrc copied"
103 |     fi
104 | fi
105 | 
106 | # .bashrc
107 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.bashrc" ]; then
108 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.bashrc" ~/
109 |     print_status ".bashrc copied"
110 | fi
111 | 
112 | # Create .config directory if it doesn't exist
113 | mkdir -p ~/.config
114 | 
115 | # starship.toml
116 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ]; then
117 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ~/.config/
118 |     print_status "starship.toml copied"
119 | elif [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ]; then
120 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ~/.config/
121 |     print_status "starship.toml copied"
122 | fi
123 | 
124 | # atuin config
125 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/atuin" ]; then
126 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/atuin
127 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/atuin/"* ~/.config/atuin/
128 |     print_status "atuin config copied"
129 | fi
130 | 
131 | # fastfetch config
132 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fastfetch" ]; then
133 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fastfetch
134 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fastfetch/"* ~/.config/fastfetch/
135 |     print_status "fastfetch config copied"
136 | fi
137 | 
138 | # fastfetch custom logo
139 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/images/jedi.png" ]; then
140 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fastfetch/assets
141 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/images/jedi.png" ~/.config/fastfetch/assets/
142 |     print_status "fastfetch custom logo (jedi.png) copied"
143 | fi
144 | 
145 | # fish config
146 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fish" ]; then
147 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fish
148 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fish/"* ~/.config/fish/
149 |     print_status "fish config copied"
150 | fi
151 | 
152 | # kitty config
153 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/kitty" ]; then
154 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/kitty
155 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/kitty/"* ~/.config/kitty/
156 |     print_status "kitty config copied"
157 | fi
158 | 
159 | # 6. Restore Fonts
160 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing fonts...${NC}"
161 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/fonts" ]; then
162 |     mkdir -p ~/.local/share/fonts
163 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/fonts/"*.ttf ~/.local/share/fonts/ 2>/dev/null || true
164 |     fc-cache -fv
165 |     print_status "Fonts installed and cache updated"
166 | else
167 |     print_warning "No fonts directory found in backup"
168 | fi
169 | 
170 | # 7. Set Default Shell to Zsh
171 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Setting default shell to zsh...${NC}"
172 | if [ "$SHELL" != "$(which zsh)" ]; then
173 |     chsh -s "$(which zsh)"
174 |     print_status "Default shell changed to zsh (will take effect on next login)"
175 | else
176 |     print_status "Zsh is already the default shell"
177 | fi
178 | 
179 | echo ""
180 | echo -e "${GREEN}=== Installation Complete! ===${NC}"
181 | echo ""
182 | echo "Please log out and log back in for the shell change to take effect."
183 | echo "Then open a new terminal to enjoy your restored setup!"
</content>
</file>
<file><path>README.md</path>
<content lines="1-87">
 1 | # Terminal Configuration & Migration
 2 | 
 3 | A backup of my custom terminal setup intended for easy migration to Nobara 42 (Fedora-based).
 4 | 
 5 | ## Description
 6 | 
 7 | This repository contains configuration files, fonts, and an automated installation script to quickly restore a fully-featured terminal environment featuring:
 8 | 
 9 | - **Zsh** - Modern shell with powerful features
10 | - **Starship** - Cross-shell prompt with extensive customization
11 | - **Atuin** - Magical shell history with sync capabilities
12 | - **Fastfetch** - System information display tool
13 | - **Kitty** - GPU-accelerated terminal emulator
14 | - **Nerd Fonts** - Patched fonts with icon support (CaskaydiaCove, FiraCode, JetBrains Mono)
15 | 
16 | ## Contents
17 | 
18 | ```
19 | terminal_backup/
20 | ├── .zshrc                    # Zsh configuration
21 | ├── .bashrc                   # Bash configuration (backup)
22 | ├── .config/                  # Application configs (starship, atuin, fastfetch)
23 | ├── fonts/                    # Nerd Fonts collection
24 | ├── install.sh                # Automated installation script
25 | └── restore_instructions.txt  # Manual plugin installation guide
26 | ```
27 | 
28 | ## Quick Start
29 | 
30 | ### Automated Installation (Recommended)
31 | 
32 | 1. Clone the repository:
33 |    ```bash
34 |    git clone <repo-url> systems-migration
35 |    cd systems-migration
36 |    ```
37 | 
38 | 2. Navigate to the backup directory:
39 |    ```bash
40 |    cd terminal_backup
41 |    ```
42 | 
43 | 3. Run the installation script:
44 |    ```bash
45 |    chmod +x install.sh
46 |    ./install.sh
47 |    ```
48 | 
49 | 4. Log out and log back in for the shell change to take effect.
50 | 
51 | The script will:
52 | - Update the system
53 | - Install Zsh, Starship, Atuin, and Fastfetch
54 | - Install Zsh plugins (autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting, autocomplete)
55 | - Restore all configuration files
56 | - Install fonts and refresh font cache
57 | - Set Zsh as the default shell
58 | 
59 | ## Manual Installation
60 | 
61 | If you prefer manual installation or need to customize the setup:
62 | 
63 | 1. Copy configuration files manually to their respective locations:
64 |    - `.zshrc` → `~/`
65 |    - `.bashrc` → `~/`
66 |    - `.config/*` → `~/.config/`
67 |    - `fonts/*.ttf` → `~/.local/share/fonts/`
68 | 
69 | 2. Install required Zsh plugins - see [`restore_instructions.txt`](terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt) for details.
70 | 
71 | 3. Refresh font cache:
72 |    ```bash
73 |    fc-cache -fv
74 |    ```
75 | 
76 | 4. Change default shell:
77 |    ```bash
78 |    chsh -s $(which zsh)
79 |    ```
80 | 
81 | ## Screenshots
82 | 
83 | *Add screenshots here*
84 | 
85 | ## License
86 | 
87 | Personal configuration backup - use at your own discretion.
</content>
</file>
</files>
